text:
Hi everyone, I am working on the CMS for Developers Practicum and I am stuck at this stage:
• Creating a Repeating Fields Module for the "Our Team" section. 
I created a new Module, added images, grouped them together and set them to "Repeating."
• The problem is that no code appears when I make this Module. And the Preview of this Module shows as blank. 
I made a quick Screen Recording of the empty code and blank preview link: *<https://www.loom.com/share/17153d5281e64e1483a321c5984c7bb9>*

I cannot find any resources to complete this task successfully. I'm grateful for any assistance! Thank you!

although `sudo` will resolve this, i would recommend updating updating how NPM is installed.  Using `sudo` should be used sparingly.  It is like giving whatever you are installing the keys to your computer
check out <https://docs.npmjs.com/resolving-eacces-permissions-errors-when-installing-packages-globally|these docs> for a couple options to fix this

hey tracy!
You are close!  Adding the fields in this sidebar does not actually add them to your html.  It will create the fields in a file called `fields.json`
once you have set your fields, you will see an option at the top right called *Actions*.  Clicking into that, you will see an option to copy the snippet.  Click that and now you can go over to the html pane and paste that snippet in
You will then see that it puts all of your fields into a for loop.  Within that loop is where you will update the structure of the html
